thread.title: We applaud this Beyonce dancer who started a fuller-figured dance company when agents wouldn’t sign her
thread.title_full: We applaud this Beyonce dancer who started a fuller-figured dance company when agents wouldn’t sign her

author: Channing Sargent
title: We applaud this Beyonce dancer who started a fuller-figured dance company when agents wouldn’t sign her
text:
We applaud this Beyonce dancer who started a fuller-figured dance company when agents wouldn’t sign her Akira Armstrong is a dancer who has been featured in two Beyoncé music videos . While we assume that’d be an incredible breakthrough for most dancers, Armstrong couldn’t find a single Los Angeles agent to represent her, because of her size .
“When people think about the stereotypical dancer’s body, they think [of someone] very thin, tall, long legs, long arms,” Armstrong said in a video for The Scene. The video, which features dancers from Armstrong’s Pretty Big Movement , a New York, NY-based dance company, went viral almost overnight.
Armstrong created her company after being judged in auditions by her body type before even receiving the opportunity to prove her skill. Pretty Big Movement showcases the sick talents of full-figured women. 
& This plus-size dance company destroys stereotypes Pretty Big Movement is destroying stereotypes about what dancers should look like: http://trib.al/4jEGJsi
Posted by The Scene on Monday, January 9, 2017 “Growing up in a dance environment, I did feel like my body was a negative [thing],” she says. “I couldn’t fit [into] costumes, and my costume was always different from everyone else’s.” Over 5 Million views on Facebook in 24hours...@thescene #GETINTOTHEMOVEMENT #iamprettybig #prettybigmovement #prettybig #JALT #curvywarriors #fullfigureddancers #plussizedancers #PrettyBIGfeva @prettybig5 @prettybig_z @c_caaakes @prettybigoneup @prettybig.babygirl @prettybigteece @prettybig_alina @prettybig_rev @therealdaytime @owntv @oprah 
A video posted by Get Into The Movement (@prettybigmovement) on Jan 10, 2017 at 9:14pm PST 
“After going on auditions and being told no, I wanted to create a platform for other plus-sized women to feel comfortable .” This is what curvy confidence looks like at the end of 2016. Stay tuned, BIG news for #prettybigmovement in 2017!!! #getintothemovement #iamprettybig #prettybig #prettybigmovement #curvywarriors #fullfigureddancers #plussizedancers #PrettyBIGfeva 
A photo posted by Get Into The Movement (@prettybigmovement) on Dec 21, 2016 at 2:40pm PST 
Armstrong hopes the Pretty Big Movement will empower young girls to know that they can be serious and respected dancers, no matter their size. @thescene presents mini documentary about @prettybig5 and the meaning of #prettybigmovement To watch the full video visit www.thescene.com @prettybig5 @prettybig_z @c_caaakes @prettybigoneup @prettybig.babygirl @prettybigteece @prettybig_alina @iamsteveharveytv @missymisdemeanorelliott @prettybig_rev @wendyshow @theellenshow #getintothemovement #iamprettybig #prettybigmovement #prettybig #JALT #curvywarriors #fullfigureddancers #plussizedancers #PrettyBIGfeva @goodmorningamerica 
A video posted by Get Into The Movement (@prettybigmovement) on Jan 9, 2017 at 9:54pm PST 
Watch the video. Consider your body stereotypes shattered. Talent favors no size.
